data.name: FailedToFindExistingCertificate
data.value: Failed to find existing certificate for renewal

data.name: FailedToObtainRealCertificate
data.value: Failed to retrieve a Production certificate

data.name: HelpText
data.value:
GlobalSign OneClickSSL(tm) Installer v{0} (c)GMO GlobalSign, 2012 ============================================================================= Use this application to redeem OneClickSSL Vouchers and automatically activate SSL security and the "secure padlock" for your website
Usage:
OneClickSSL -? | -help OneClickSSL [options] Voucher DomainName [IPAddress]
Activate SSL Example(s): ======================== oneclickssl AD34EF6700G67142 www.mydomain.com oneclickssl AD34EF6700G67142 www.mydomain.com -natip 192.168.2.1 -debug oneclickssl NONUNIQUEVOUCHER www.mydomain.com -voucheroption j.doe@mydomain.com
Revoke SSL Example(s): (For Advanced Users Only) ================================================ oneclickssl -revoke 0100012698b9b97c www.mydomain.com oneclickssl -debug -revoke 0100012698b9b97c www.mydomain.com -natip 192.168.2.1
Options: -revoke -sslport SSLPort -voucheroption "Options" -language LanguageCode -natip NATIPAddress -debug -testurl WebServiceURL -quiet
Description: -? or -help - Display this help Voucher - This is the GlobalSign OneClickSSL Voucher as provided by GlobalSign or an associated partner DomainName - The website address and common name. IPAddress - The IP address for the IIS SSL website binding. If omitted, DNS will be used to obtain this.
-revoke - Revoke a certificate based on Serial Number and domain name -sslport SSLPort - Optional SSL HTTP port number if not 443 -voucheroption "Options" - Promotional voucher codes used to create trial certificates must be accompanied with a valid email address to allow additional instructions to be provided. -language LanguageCode - Specifies the output translation. Can be either en, fr, ja, nl, de, or es -natip NATIPAddress - The local IP address for NAT based networks. Only necessary if using a network translated IP -siteid IISSiteNumber - The ID number for the website in IIS. Use this if the site can not be automatically identified by the domain name. -debug - Verbose output for debugging problems -testurl WebServiceURL - Allows the use of alternative web service URL -quiet - Suppresses all output

data.name: InvalidOperatingSystem
data.value: Operating System Unsupported. Must be Windows Server 2003 SP1 or above.

data.value: Domain Name is not in the correct format

data.value: SSL Port is invalid or missing

data.value: SSL Port is not in range

data.name: ParameterTestWebServiceInvalid
data.value: Test web service URL is invalid. It must be https based.

data.name: ProcessingText
data.value:
GlobalSign OneClickSSL(tm) Installer v{0} (c)GMO GlobalSign, 2012 ============================================================================= Use this application to redeem OneClickSSL Vouchers and automatically activate SSL security and the "secure padlock" for your website.
OneClickSSL secure site activation in process. Do not close or navigate away from this page until completed... ---------------------------------------------------------------

data.value: Setting up SSL and activating secure web site...

data.name: SetupUnSuccessful
data.value: We have been unable to install an SSL certificate. We suggest that you run the install for a second time and use the debug mode to identify any obvious errors.The debug output is also a useful file for your support team. Append ">debugoutput.txt" to the command line to save the output to a txt file. A help menu is available with oneclickssl -? or -help

data.name: DNSSetToResolveInternally
data.value: The DNS search for your domain has provided the same IP address as your NAT setting. This seems to indicate that you have an Internal DNS server. Please modify the 'hosts' file on this server to point to the true external DNS IP address for this installation to succeed. The hosts file can be found in the windows/system32/drivers/etc directory and must be edited in must be edited in Administrator mode with Notepad or an equivalent editor.

data.name: FormAgreement
data.value: I have read and agree to the terms and conditions of the OneClickSSL Subscriber Agreement

data.name: FormIntroDescription
data.value: Use this application to redeem OneClickSSL vouchers and automatically activate SSL security and the "secure padlock" for your website.

data.name: FormAgreementLink
data.value: Click here to view the Subscriber Agreement

data.name: FormAdvancedOptionsHelp
data.value: These options allow you to provide additional advanced level options for your SSL deployment or revocation.

data.name: FormRevokeWarning
data.value: Are you sure you wish to revoke the SSL certificate which belongs to this domain? If you do choose to continue, then the process cannot be reversed and any relying parties who connect to this web site will be warned by their browser software that the web site certificate is no longer valid. It is suggested that revocation is performed only for the loss/compromise of the private key associated with the SSL certificate or information within the certificate is deemed to be incorrect.

data.name: FormErrorOccured
data.value: An error occured. Click here for more information

data.name: FormKeyInformationMissing
data.value: You must provide all information before proceeding

data.name: ManualConfigurationPause
data.value: The temporary certificate has been installed into the certificate store. You may now perform any necessary manual processing steps. Press OK to continue the process of applying for a Production certificate

data.name: FollowingCertInstalled
data.value: The following certificate will be installed

data.name: NewCSR
data.value: Analysing and processing new CSR request

data.name: CSRDisplay
data.value: SUCCEEDED - CSR generated is as follows

data.name: HelpTextLinux
data.value:
GlobalSign OneClickSSL(tm) Installer v{0} (c)GMO GlobalSign, 2012 ============================================================================= GlobalSign OneClickSSL(tm) Installer (c)GMO GlobalSign, 2012 ============================================================================= Use this application to redeem OneClickSSL Vouchers and automatically activate SSL security and the "secure padlock" for your website
Usage:
php oneclickssl.php -h php oneclickssl.php -v Voucher -d DomainName [IPAddress] -o emailaddress
Activate SSL Example(s): ======================== php oneclickssl.php -v AD34EF6700G67142 -d www.mydomain.com -o email@example.com php oneclickssl.php -v NONUNIQUEVOUCHER -d www.mydomain.com -o j.doe@mydomain.com
Revoke SSL Example(s): (For Advanced Users Only) ================================================ php oneclickssl.php -r -v 0100012698b9b97c -d www.mydomain.com -o email@domain.com
Options: -r -s SSLPort -o "Options" -l LanguageCode -testurl WebServiceURL
Description: -h - Display this help -v Voucher - This is the GlobalSign OneClickSSL Voucher as provided by GlobalSign or an associated partner -d DomainName - The website address and common name. -r - Revoke a certificate based on Serial Number and domain name -s Port - Optional SSL HTTP port number if not 443 -o "Options" - Promotional voucher codes used to create trial certificates must be accompanied with a valid email address to allow additional instructions to be provided. -l LanguageCode - Specifies the output translation. Can be either en, fr, ja, jp, nl, de, or es -t WebServiceURL - Allows the use of alternative web service URL

data.name: FormObtainingVouchersDescription
data.value: Customize the experience for domain owners. You have the ability to control the experience of domain owners and the methods by which they obtain OneClickSSL vouchers. Please change the URL below to a landing page of your own if you are a GlobalSign reseller. The URL is called when domain owners click on the 'No Voucher, Get one here' image from within their plugin.
